decks.notes: The key concept of this Nin, the Pain Artist deck is control. The deck aims to maintain control of the game by countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. It includes a variety of counterspells like Spell Pierce, Negate, and Counterspell, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Flame Slash, and Anger of the Gods. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection spells such as Brainstorm, Impulse, and Fact or Fiction to maintain a steady flow of resources and answers. Additionally, it includes powerful control tools like Vedalken Shackles and Cryptic Command to manipulate the board state and ensure dominance.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and flexibility through various counterspells, removal spells, and card draw options. Breya, Etherium Shaper serves as a versatile commander that can create blockers, remove threats, and act as a win condition with her ability to deal direct damage. The deck aims to control the game through a combination of board wipes like Wrath of God and Damnation, efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and Terminate, and powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command. Additionally, the deck includes mana rocks and fixing to ensure consistent access to its powerful spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Breya, Etherium Shaper as the commander to control the game by countering opponent's spells, disrupting their strategy, and removing threats from the board. The deck includes a variety of control spells such as Counterspell, Mana Leak, and Muddle the Mixture to keep the opponent's game plan in check. It also includes powerful artifacts like Isochron Scepter and Engineered Explosives to further control the board. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support the control elements with a mix of lands that provide different colors of mana. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of powerful spells and versatile artifacts.

The deck revolves around using Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to control the game through various spells and card draw. The key concept is to manipulate time and resources efficiently to outvalue the opponent and maintain board control. By leveraging extra turn spells, bounce effects, and card filtering, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The inclusion of high tide and mana rocks like Mox Diamond allows for explosive mana generation to cast big spells and overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Force of Will provide necessary protection to ensure the deck's game plan can be executed smoothly.

The main concept of this Baral, Chief of Compliance deck is to control the game through powerful counter spells and card draw, while also utilizing efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. With a heavy focus on countering opponent's spells and drawing cards to maintain card advantage, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. By utilizing Baral's cost reduction ability and a high number of instants and sorceries, the deck can generate significant advantage over time and win through card advantage and tempo. With a strong control suite and versatile threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through efficient play and strategic decision-making.

The deck revolves around using Breya, Etherium Shaper as a control commander to manage and manipulate the game. The main focus is on card advantage, removal, and counter spells to control the board while setting up powerful win conditions. The deck includes a wide range of versatile spells like Demonic Tutor, Vindicate, Wrath of God, and Cryptic Command to handle different threats efficiently. It also includes various mana rocks and lands to ensure consistent mana production and fixing. With a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while setting up Breya or other finishers to secure victory in the game.

The deck revolves around using Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes powerful control spells like Counterspell, Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Mana Leak to counter threats and control the board. The deck also includes a variety of disruptive cards like Spell Queller, Vendilion Clique, and Venser, Shaper Savant to further disrupt the opponent's plans. The inclusion of equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Steel of the Godhead helps to enhance Geist of Saint Traft's abilities and make it a potent threat on the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, disrupt the opponent, and win through Geist of Saint Traft's powerful abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, card draw, and manipulating the opponent's deck. The deck utilizes Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to provide additional card advantage and graveyard recursion. With a plethora of card draw spells like Brainstorm, Fact or Fiction, and Deep Analysis, the deck aims to dig deep into the library for key pieces. Counterspells such as Force of Will and Cryptic Command help in disrupting the opponent's strategies. The deck also includes high mana producing artifacts like Chrome Mox and Gauntlet of Power to cast powerful spells like Blue Sun's Zenith and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Overall, the strategy revolves around outsmarting opponents and controlling the pace of the game.
